headline.print_headline: Prison Death Brings Outcry Against Cuba
headline.seo: Cuba Is Condemned After Prisoner’s Death
headline.main: Prison Death Brings Outcry Against Cuba

docs.snippet: Human rights advocates and American officials criticized the government for limiting political freedom after a dissident who had carried out a hunger strike died....

keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
keywords.name: subject

docs.abstract: Human rights advocates and American officials, reacting to death of imprisoned dissident Wilman Villar Mendoza, condemn the Cuban government for continuing to limit political freedom; Villar Mendoza had carried out a hunger strike to protest his sentence.
docs.lead_paragraph: Human rights advocates and American officials criticized the government for limiting political freedom after a dissident who had carried out a hunger strike died.

headline.seo: Giants’ Manning Develops Arm Strength by Working From the Feet Up

headline.print_headline: A Nobel Laureate’s Problem at Home
headline.seo: In Liberia, a Nobel Laureate’s Problem
headline.main: A Nobel Laureate’s Problem at Home

docs.snippet: President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf risks future conflict by awarding land inhabited by rural Liberians to foreign investors....
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by community rights activists Silas Kpanan'Ayoung Siakor and Rachael S Knight asserts that Liberia's President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf is risking future conflict by awarding huge tracts of land inhabited by rural Liberians to foreign investors.

byline.original: By SILAS KPANAN'AYOUNG SIAKOR and RACHAEL S. KNIGHT

docs.lead_paragraph: President Ellen Johnson Sirleaf risks future conflict by awarding land inhabited by rural Liberians to foreign investors.

headline.print_headline: A ‘Porgy’ for Theatergoers, Not for Fans of the Opera
headline.seo: ‘Gershwins’ Porgy and Bess’ on Broadway Is More for Theater Fans
headline.main: A ‘Porgy’ for Theatergoers, Not for Fans of the Opera

docs.snippet: The New York Times theater critic Charles Isherwood says people unfamiliar with “Porgy and Bess” seem to like the new version on Broadway, unlike most critics....
docs.abstract: Charles Isherwood reflects that many theatergoers unfamiliar with the Gershwin opera Porgy and Bess seem to enjoy the theatrical edited version now on Broadway, unlike most critics who find it vastly inferior to the original 1935 opera.
docs.lead_paragraph: The New York Times theater critic Charles Isherwood says people unfamiliar with “Porgy and Bess” seem to like the new version on Broadway, unlike most critics.
